title: Contributing a Research article
text:
Inserting data from Ortege Lakehouse
The great thing about Quarto is that you can embed code. That means you’ll be able to embed code directly into your Ortege Researh article and when the article gets accepted, the code will be executed and the results of the code displayed in your research article.
Let’s unpack that by adding a bar char of Bitcoin Hash power over the past month.


Missing Datasets
If your research report needs data that isn’t in our lakehouse, you have a few options in order to get the data into our lakehouse. 1. Send us the Parquet files of the dataset 2. Create a pipeline by submitting a PR to Ortege’s open source ETL codebase 3. Reach out to the team to discuss a joint effort

title: Contributing a Research article
text:
Contributing a research article through Ortege is a great way for budding crypto research analysts and more general data analysts to showcase their skills to the broader community and gain some exposure.
In this article, we’ll walk you through how simple it is to create a research article. We’ll walk through an example of creating a Bitcoin research article.
First navigate to articles folder in this repository and make a copy of the template.

title: Quick Start
text:
Welcome to Ortege Studio, your premier destination for insightful data analytics and AI-driven exploration in the realm of blockchain data. This guide is crafted to help you swiftly navigate through Ortege Studio’s robust features, ensuring an efficient and productive start.
This guide will walk you through creating a simple Bitcoin visualization.


Begin your journey by accessing Ortege Studio through our dedicated web portal. Ensure you have your login credentials ready, which you would have received upon your successful registration.
Please note Currently user logins for Ortege Studio are restricted to whitelisted users.

title: Quick Start
text:
Begin your journey by accessing Ortege Studio through our dedicated web portal. Ensure you have your login credentials ready, which you would have received upon your successful registration.
Please note Currently user logins for Ortege Studio are restricted to whitelisted users.

title: Quick Start
text:
Querying Bitcoin
Ortege Studio seamlessly integrates with a variety of blockchain data sources. To connect, navigate to the ‘SQL Lab’ section.

title: Quick Start
text:
Data Exploration
Please connect to:

Database = “Ortege Lakehouse Test”
Schema = “bitcoin”

Now please run the following SQL Query:
SELECT 
    tx.block_number - tx.block_number % 1000 AS block_number,
    ox.script_pub_key.type,
    COUNT(*) AS output_count
FROM 
    bitcoin.transactions tx
CROSS JOIN 
    UNNEST(tx.output) AS ox
WHERE 
    tx.is_coinbase
GROUP BY 
    1, 2
ORDER BY 
    1;
This query looks at transactions on Bitcoin whereby miners are rewarded for mining blocks and is categorized according to the output type of the transaction.
Please note: A coinbase transaction has to do with a type of transaction that appears in every new block of a blockchain and is not to be confused with the Coinbase Centralized Exchange. Please see here for more information.

title: Quick Start
text:
Visualization
Transform your data into compelling visual stories. Select from a range of visualization tools within Ortege Studio to depict your data in the most impactful way.

title: Quick Start
text:
Collaborate and Share
Collaboration is key in data analytics. Ortege Studio facilitates sharing your findings with team members. Utilize our sharing features to collaborate effectively, enhancing the collective understanding of blockchain data.

title: Quick Start
text:
Exporting Results
For external presentations or reports, easily export your visualizations and data insights from Ortege Studio in various formats.

title: Ortege Lakehouse
text:
We host our lakehouse on Azure Storage. So we do incur costs for it. We want to make our Lakehouse available to all, and at present is currently available through Ortege Studio.
Please read our Data Ontology in order to acquaint yourself with how the data is structured throughout all Ortege products.

title: Data Ontology
text:
If you’re looking to be heavily involved in Ortege, then this will be one of the most important areas to understand.
Our data is deployed as Delta Lake tables and adhere to the following naming conventions.

title: Data Ontology
text:
Blockchains
TODO Add some data here explaining the different classifications of Blockchains. Link to some Jon Charbaneu stuff.

title: Data Ontology
text:
Account Types
An important distinction between blockchains is their ledger model. This indicates how the underlying blockchain ledger records information about token transfers and balances. The two major classifcations are: * UTXO * Accounts based model
In our Data Ontology we classify Blockchains as below:

title: Data Ontology
text:
Blocks
Lifecycle of a block




flowchart TD
    A[Block gets produced] --> B[Ortege Streaming checks blockchain type]
    B -->|EVM| C1[Redpanda producer for EVM]
    B -->|UTXO_Dumb| C2[Redpanda producer for UTXO_Dumb]
    B -->|Substrate| C3[Redpanda producer for Substrate]
    B -->|SVM| C4[Redpanda producer for SVM]

    C1 -->|br_evm_<name>_produce_block| D1[Consumer adds to Delta Lake]
    C2 -->|br_utxo_dumb_<name>_produce_block| D2[Consumer adds to Delta Lake]
    C3 -->|br_substrate_<name>_produce_block| D3[Consumer adds to Delta Lake]
    C4 -->|br_svm_<name>_produce_block| D4[Consumer adds to Delta Lake]

    D1 -->|br_evm_<name>_block_added| E1[Query token price and miner earnings]
    D2 -->|br_utxo_dumb_<name>_block_added| E2[Query token price and miner earnings]
    D3 -->|br_substrate_<name>_block_added| E3[Query token price and miner earnings]
    D4 -->|br_svm_<name>_block_added| E4[Query token price and miner earnings]

    E1 --> H1[Convert timestamp to date-time]
    E2 --> H2[Convert timestamp to date-time]
    E3 --> H3[Convert timestamp to date-time]
    E4 --> H4[Convert timestamp to date-time]

    H1 --> F1[Update Silver Layer with EVM data]
    H2 --> F2[Update Silver Layer with UTXO_Dumb data]
    H3 --> F3[Update Silver Layer with Substrate data]
    H4 --> F4[Update Silver Layer with SVM data]

    E2 -->|If PoW| G2[Populate Hashrate for UTXO_Dumb]
    G2 --> F2

title: Data Ontology
text:
Transactions
Lifecycle of a transaction





flowchart TD
    A[Transaction gets produced] --> B[Ortege streaming checks blockchain type]
    B -->|EVM| C1[RedPanda topic for EVM]
    B -->|UTXO_Dumb| C2[RedPanda topic for UTXO_Dumb]
    B -->|Substrate| C3[RedPanda topic for Substrate]
    B -->|SVM| C4[RedPanda topic for SVM]

    C1 --> D[Consumer writes to Bronze layer]
    C2 --> D
    C3 --> D
    C4 --> D

    D --> E[Check if addresses are categorized in Silver layer]
    E -->|If not| F[Classify address as 'account' or 'smart contract']
    E --> G[Check if address transacted before on this chain]
    G -->|If not| H[Tag as 'new_address_on_chain' with date]

    H --> I[Check address on related chains]
    I -->|If active on other chains| J[Tag as 'multichain address']

    J --> K[Check for labels from Etherscan]
    K -->|If no labels| L[Query Etherscan and add labels to Silver layer]

    L --> M[Check how the wallet was funded]
    M -->|Funded from CEX| N[Tag as 'funded_from_CEX']
    M -->|Funded from known account/contract| O[Tag as 'funded_from_known_source']
    M -->|Funded from unknown source| P[Tag as 'funded_from_unknown_source']

    P --> Q[Check token balances in Silver layer]
    Q --> R[Push balances data to Gold layer in 'address_balances' table]

title: Data Ontology
text:
Smart contracts
Lifecycle of a smart contract





flowchart TD
    A[Contract gets produced] --> B[Send to Ortege streaming service]
    B --> C[Produced as a RedPanda topic]
    C --> D[Pushed to Bronze layer as a Delta table]

    D --> E[Determine contract type]
    E -->|Token Contract| F1[Process Token Contract]
    E -->|NFT Contract| F2[Process NFT Contract]
    E -->|Interchain Token| F3[Update Cross Chain table in Silver layer]
    E -->|Basket Token| F4[Update Balances in Silver layer]
    E -->|Vault Token| F5[Update Vault details in Silver layer]
    E -->|Unidentified Token| F6[Check Etherscan for ABI]

    F6 -->|ABI found| G1[Upload ABI to Silver layer]
    F6 -->|ABI not found| G2[Decompile Contract and upload ABI]
    
    G1 --> H[Scan Token for Vulnerabilities]
    G2 --> H
    F1 --> H
    F2 --> H
    F3 --> H
    F4 --> H
    F5 --> H

    H -->|Vulnerabilities found| I[Produce Event to RedPanda]

title: Ortege Studio
text:
Ortege Studio can be located at https://app.ortege.xyz
Currently it is a closed beta. If you’d like to gain access please email christos@ortege.io

title: Research Articles
text:
The Research reports will be updated daily with fresh data. This means we provide what internally we call, realtime Research articles. We grew frustrated with the high cost of solutions such as Messari and their point in time reports. We believe there is a better way to serve the crypto community: * Open access to market research * Presented in a visual style that encourages data storytelling * Research reports that update with live data

Current Reports

State of Bitcoin



Technologies used
We use Streamlit in order to host our charts and visualizations.


Contributing
Anyone can release a research article and submit a PR in our Github. If the research article is accepted, it will deployed to our production documentation site and we will promote your article on our socials.
Please see the contributing guide to learn more about how to submit your own research report.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text: Ortege excels in delivering unparalleled insights into blockchain ecosystems. Our tools empower you to unlock more possibilities, completely free of charge.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
🔥 Ortege Studio
Ortege Studio allows you to dive into blockchain data analysis, craft engaging visualizations, and share your findings through interactive dashboards.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
🌐 OrtegeGPT
Explore the future of AI-assisted data analysis with OrtegeGPT. This revolutionary chatbot provides insights into both on-chain and off-chain data, leveraging advanced AI for quick, accurate answers and analytics.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
Ortege Research
Delve into the world of crypto with our comprehensive Ortege Research articles. Freely accessible to all, we cover more chains and dApps than any other competitor.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
🌟 Ortege Lakehouse
Introducing Ortege Lakehouse - our open data lakehouse. Accessible to everyone, it allows for both accessing and contributing data.

title: OrtegeGPT
text:
OrtegeGPT is the primary way we’d like our users to discover Ortege. All our documentation in this site is deployed into our own Large Language Model, or LLM. We then deploy this as a chat agent that our users can utilise in order to discover Ortege and it’s suite of products.
Our first chat agent is called Asimov and is in active development at the moment.
While he is not deployed at present, he should be up and running in the next few weeks and deployed via Hugging Face Spaces.
